result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew M Leichtnam appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by phone for Andrew M Leichtnam. Defendant waives right to in person appearance. Plea questionnaire efiled. Plea colloquy. Defendant advised of rights. With a plea to count 1, count 2 to be DRI and count 3 dismissed as operation of law. Parties free to argue sentence. Amended plea questionnaire filed. No restitution request filed. No victim's rights issues. Defendant enters NC plea to count 1, court finds defendant guilty.  Court revokes bond. Court orders a PSI. Court DRI count 2, count 3 dismissed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
